description: White. Small, single. Neat, compact growth. E-M. Slightly fragrant. (Grijsii x unknown pollen parent). (U.S. 1998 - Charvet).

name: Pop Allen
description: Dark Pink with Darker Pink flashes, petals occasionally cupped. Medium, formal double. Vigorous, upright growth. M. (U.S. 2001 - Carl Allen, Jr., Wilmington, NC).

name: Pop Gee
description: Deep Rose Pink. Very large, semidouble with heavy cluster of stamens. Vigorous, open, upright growth. E-M. (Reticulata 'Crimson Robe' x Granthamiana). (U.S. 1974 - Homeyer).

name: Pop Homeyer
description: Deep Rose Pink and White and Pink center radial stripes. Large to very large, semidouble to anemone form to peony form. Vigorous, spreading, upright growth. E-L. (Reticulata 'Crimson Robe' x'Granthamiana'). (U.S. 1978 - Homeyer).

name: Pop's Perfection
description: Medium Pink flecked and streaked with Darker Burgundy to Deep Coral Pink at the center of petals. Small, formal double. Slow, spreading, open growth. M-L. (U.S. 2009 - John M. Davy, Milton, FL).

name: Pop's Perfection Peppermint
description: Burgundy stripes on a Pink background; tendency to sport one colored flower. Small, formal double. Very slow growth. M-L. (U.S. - John M. Davy, Milton, FL).

name: Popcorn
description: White. Large, semidouble with high petaloid center. (U.S. 1971 - Wilson).

name: Pope John Xxiii
description: White. Medium to large, formal double with heavy, velvet textured petals. Vigorous, compact, upright growth. M. (U.S. 1967 - Maitland).

name: Pope Pius Ix
description: See 'Prince Eugene Napoleon'. (Not same as cultivar listed in old literature, which is 'Pie IX').

name: Poppy Sans
description: Orange Pink. Miniature, semidouble with occasional center petaloids and upright petals. Average, upright growth. M-L. (U.S. 1956 - Metcalf).

name: Popsy
description: White. Miniature, single. Dwarf growth. M. (Pitardii seedling). (Aus. 1985 - Sebire).

name: Porcelain Doll
description: Blush Pink. Miniature, formal double. Slow growth. L. (U.S. 1997 - Domoto).

name: Portuense
description: Red. Small, peony form with variegated foliage. (Portugal 1958 - Da Silva).

name: Portugese Pink
description: See 'Augusto L'Gouveia Pinto'.

name: Post Time
description: Pink fading to Light Pink at edge. Large, semidouble. Average, open, upright growth. E-M. (U.S. 1966 - Ashby).

name: Potentate
description: Rose Red. Small, formal double. (Possibly a Japonica ' Reverend John G. Drayton' seedling). (Europe to U.S. 1840's - Magnolia Plantation & Gardens, Charleston, SC).

name: Potomac Pillar
description: White. Medium to large, semidouble form. Average, upright growth. M-L. Cold hardy. (U.S. 1999 - Dr. Arthur A. Maryott, Gaithersburg, MD).

name: Pouf
description: Cream White with one Red petal. Small, full peony form. Slow, compact, upright growth. M. (U.S. 1963 - Novick).

name: Powder Puff
description: White. Small to medium, peony form. Average growth. M. (U.S. 1960 - Hartman).

name: Powder Snow
description: White with Yellow anthers and Cream filaments. Small, anemone form. Vigorous, upright, open growth. E-L. (Seedling of Japonica 'Tiffany'). (U.S. 2020 - Pat B. Johnson, Cairo, GA).

name: Powdered Beauty
description: Red with Silver fluorescence. Very large, loose peony form. Average, upright, spreading growth. E-L. (U.S. 2000 - Edith Mazzei, Clayton, CA).

name: Powell's Pink
description: See 'Herme Pink'.

name: Prairie Fires
description: Oriental Red. Medium to large, formal double to anemone form. Average, compact growth. E-L. (U.S. 1967 - Short).

name: Prairie Jefferson
description: Rose. Medium, formal double. Average, upright growth. M. (U.S. 1964 - Mrs. W. M. Nolan, Oak Ridge, LA).

name: Pratten's Pink
description: See 'Shell Pink Special

name: Preacher's Ella
description: Mass of White incurved petals shading to Orchid Pink at edge. Medium, formal double to rose form double. (Sport of Japonica 'Ella Ward Parsons'). (U.S. 1980 - J. Austin, Four Oaks, NC).

name: Prelude
description: Clear Turkey Red. Medium, semidouble to anemone form. Vigorous, compact, upright growth. E-M. (U.S. 1950 - E. W. Miller, Escondido, CA).

name: Prelude Variegated
description: Turkey Red blotched White variation of 'Prelude'.

name: Premier
description: Clear Rose Red. Large, full peony form. Vigorous, upright growth. M-L. (U.S. 1965 - Short).

name: Premier Variegated
description: Clear Rose Red blotched White variation of 'Premier'. (U.S. 1973 - L Baskerville, San Diego, CA).

name: President Lincoln
description: Red. Medium, anemone form. Vigorous, upright growth. L. (U.S. 1955 - Goletto).

name: Pretty In Pink
description: Pink, with Lighter Pink center. Miniature, formal double. Average growth. M-L. (U.S. 1987 - D. Bergamini, Martinez, CA).

name: Pretty Lady
description: Pink. Large, formal double to rose form double. Vigorous, open, upright growth. M-L. (Reticulata hybrid 'Suzanne Withers' × Reticulata hybrid 'Jean Pursel'). (Aus. 1998 - Dr. R. Withers, Donvale, Vic.).

name: Pretty One
description: Coral Pink shading to White in center. Medium, semidouble to loose peony form. Vigorous, upright growth. E-L. (U.S. 1975 - Novick).

name: Pretty Pantalettes
description: Soft Pink with White band. Medium, semidouble. Average, upright growth. M. (U.S. 1957 - McCaskill).

name: Pretty Patsy
description: Light Purple, deepening at edge of petals. Miniature, semidouble form

name: Pretty Peach
description: Peach Pink. Medium, peony form. Vigorous, dense, upright growth. M-L. (U.S. 1999 - William R. Blackman, Easley, SC).

name: Pretty Peggy
description: Dark Red with Black veining and White moiré variegation with Yellow anthers and Pink filaments. Medium, full peony. Average, spreading and open growth. E-M. (U.S. 2016 - Ed Powers, Wilmington, NC).

name: Pretty Penny
description: Shell Pink, lighter at edge. Medium, formal double with pointed petals standing apart of cone form. Vigorous, upright growth. M. (U.S. 1964 - R. W. Wilder, Fairhope, AL).

name: Pretty Pink
description: ('Fenejiao' - Chinese Name). Spinel Pink. Medium, semidouble with outer petals slightly undulate, inner whorls curved, erect. E. (China 1981 - Kunming Botanical Garden).

name: Pretty Thing
description: Light Pink. Medium to large, semidouble. Vigorous, compact, upright growth. M. (U.S. 1971 - B. Leeton, Gulfport, MS).

name: Pride Of California
description: Orange Pink. Miniature, formal double. Slow growth. M. (U.S. 1977 - W. L. Gilmore, Conroe, TX).

name: Pride Of Greenville
description: ('Steven's Pink'; 'Red Dale'). Bright Red. Medium to large, full peony form. Vigorous, upright growth. M-L. (U.S. 1897 - Greenville, AL).

name: Pride Of Gulfport
description: Bright Red. Large, semidouble to peony form. (U.S. 1948 - Clower).

name: Pride Of Portland
description: See 'Lady de Saumarez'.

name: Pride Of Rosebud Farm
description: See 'Lady de Saumarez'.

name: Pride Of The Emperor's Garden
description: See 'Elegans (Chandler) Variegated'.

name: Prima Ballerina
description: White washed and shaded Orchid Pink. Medium to large, semidouble with fluted petals. Average, compact growth. M-L. (U.S. 1983 - Nuccio's).

name: Prima Donna
description: Bright Pink. Medium, semidouble. Vigorous, bushy growth. L. (Not the cultivar listed in old literature, which was star shaped semidouble of Pink margined White and veined Pink). (Europe to U.S. [Tea Gardens] 1890).

name: Prima Donna Variegated
description: Bright Pink marbled White form of 'Prima Donna'.

name: Primavera
description: White. Medium, formal double. Vigorous, upright growth. M-L. (U.S. 1950 - Nuccio's).

name: Prime Fragrance
description: Deep Red. Medium, peony form. Average, upright growth. M-L. Fragrant. (N.Z. 1994 - J. Finlay).

name: Prime Time
description: Deep Red. Large to very large, semidouble. Average, upright growth. M-L. (Reticulata 'Crimson Robe' x Reticulata/ Japonica hybrid). (U.S. 1980 - Pursel).

name: Prince Charlie
description: Velvet Red. Medium, semidouble. Slow, compact, upright growth. M-L. (U.S. 1950 - L. A. Walker, Summerville, SC).

name: Prince Charming
description: Deep Rose-Pink. Medium, anemone form with small petaloids and large petals. Vigorous, compact growth. E-M. (U.S. 1948 - John S. Armstrong, Ontario, CA).

name: Prince Eugene Napoleon
description: ('Pope Pius IX'; 'Imbricata Rubra Plena'; 'Ladiner's Red'). Cherry Red. Medium, formal double with many small, rounded petals which are progressively smaller toward center. Average, compact, upright growth. M. (Belgium 1859 - De Coster, Melle).

name: Prince Frederick William
description: Light Pink. Medium, formal double. Upright, open growth. M. (For a variation of this cultivar see 'Lady Hope'). (Aus. 1875 - Sheather).

name: Prince Murat
description: Rose Red. Very large, rose form double. Vigorous growth. M. (U.S. 1952 - Rosa).

name: Prince Of Orange
description: ('Crusader'). Deep Orange Red. Large, loose to full peony form to anemone form. Vigorous, compact, upright growth. M. (For a variation of this cultivar see 'Governor William Bradford'). (U.S. 1950 - Clower).

name: Prince Of Orange Variegated
description: See 'Governor William Bradford

name: Prince-N-Red
description: Dark Red. Small, formal double. Average, upright, dense growth. M-L. (Seedling of Japonica 'Royal Velvet'). (U.S. 2019 - Pat Johnson, Cairo, GA).

name: Princess Anne
description: See 'Rubenceus Major Variegated'.

name: Princess Baciocchi
description: Carmine. Medium, semidouble to peony form. Vigorous, bushy growth. M. (For original cultivar see 'Princesse Baciocchi'). (U.S. 1930 - Armstrong).

name: Princess Di
description: White. Miniature, single; petals wavy and notched. Slow, upright growth. M-L. (Aus. 1998 - Mr. and Mrs. G. Waldon, Wodonga, Vic.).

name: Princess Irene
description: Rose Pink. Medium, semidouble to peony form with bell shaped petaloids among petals. Slow, upright growth. E. (Europe to U.S. [Magnolia] 1840's).

name: Princess Irene Variegated
description: Rose Pink marbled White form of 'Princess Irene.

name: Princess Lavender
description: Lavender Pink. Large, semidouble. Vigorous, compact growth. M. (U.S. 1950 - Wilkinson).

name: Princess Lear
description: Coral Pink faintly streaked Deeper Pink. Medium, full peony form. Vigorous, open, upright growth. M. (U.S. 1958 - Ragland).

name: Princess Lucille
description: See 'Beauty of Holland'.

name: Princess Masako
description: White with a Red border and small and large stripes. Medium to large, lotus form semidouble to peony form. Vigorous, initially upright, later spreading growth. M-L. (Sport of Japonica 'Ikari- shibori'). (Japan 1989 - Sôshin Hirai, Saitama Prefecture).

name: Princess Murat
description: Solid Deep Rose Pink. Medium, anemone form to loose peony form with petals notched, cup-shaped and slightly crêped. Vigorous, bushy growth. M. (U.S. 1949 - Rosa).

name: Princess Nagasaki
description: See 'Nagasaki'.

name: Princess-N-Pink
description: Light Pink with Yellow anthers and Cream filaments. Medium, anemone. Average, upright, dense growth. E-M. (U.S. 2017 - Pat Johnson, Cairo, GA).

name: Princess-N-Waiting
description: Delicate Pink with Yellow anthers and Cream filaments. Large, semidouble to loose peony form. Average, upright, open growth. M-L. (U.S. 2019 - Pat Johnson, Cairo, GA).

name: Princess-N-White
description: White with Yellow anthers and Creamy Yellow filaments. Medium to large, anemone form. Average, upright, open growth. E-L. (U.S. 2019 - Pat Johnson, Cairo, GA).

name: Princesse Baciocchi
description: Crimson with White radial bars. Medium, formal double. Slow, compact growth. M-L. (Italy 1850 - Boffi).

name: Prissie Miss
description: Pink. Medium to large, formal double to rose form double. Vigorous, upright growth. M-L. (U.S. 1975 - Novick).

name: Pristine
description: Pristine White with Pale Yellow to Pale Gold anthers and White to very Pale Yellow filaments. Large, semidouble form; the bloom has tall petal structure. Average, upright, open growth. E-M. (Seedling of Reticulata hybrid 'Frank Houser'). (U.S. 2021 - Grant Montana, Midway, GA).

name: Pristine Beauty
description: Blush Pink. Small, formal double form. Average, upright, open growth. E-M. (Seedling of Japonica 'Beatrix Hoyt Variegated'). (U.S. 2020 - Pat B. Johnson, Cairo, GA).

name: Pristine Fragrance
description: Rose Pink. Medium, anemone form. Average, open, upright growth. E-L. Fragrant. (N.Z. 1993 - J. Finlay).

name: Private Secretary
description: Red. Medium, semidouble. Average, upright growth. M-L. (U.S. 1962).

name: Professor Charles S. Sargent
description: Dark Red. Medium, full peony to anemone form. Vigorous, compact, upright growth. M. (For a variation of this cultivar see 'Woody Estes'). (U.S. 1925 - Magnolia).

name: Professor Charles S. Sargent Variegated
description: (Red Shadow'). Dark Red mottled White variation of 'Professor Charles S. Sargent.'.

name: Professor Frank Hubert
description: Deep Red. Large, formal double with upright center petals. Vigorous growth. M. (U.S. 1959 - B. Smith, Orange, TX).

name: Professor James May
description: Spinel Pink. Medium to large, peony form. Vigorous, open, upright growth. M-L. (Aus. 1984 - M. E. Greentree, Kingsgrove, NSW).

name: Professor John L. Spencer
description: Red with Yellow anthers and Rose filaments. Medium, rose form double. Vigorous, upright, spreading, open growth. M-L. (U.S. 2006 - John L Spencer, Lakeland, FL)

name: Professor Tsai
description: ('Maye Taohong' - Chinese Name'; 'Reticulate Leaf Crimson'). Delicate Rose Pink often fading to Silver-Pink at center. Medium, semidouble with open tiers of waved petals surrounding center of petaloids with a few stamens. Average growth. M-L. (China - there is an old tree at the Panlong Temple estimated to be over 600 years old - Kunming, Yunnan).

name: Professore Giovanni Santarelli
description: White blotched and striped Dark Pink to Crimson. Medium, rose form double. Upright, bushy growth. M-L. (Italy 1860 - Santarelli).

name: Promises
description: Rose Red. Large, semidouble with occasional upright petals. Vigorous, open, upright growth. E-M. (Reticulata 'Crimson Robe' x Granthamiana). (U.S. 1975 - Homeyer)

name: Prudence
description: Rich Pink. Miniature, semidouble. Dwarf, upright growth. M. (Pitardii seedling). (N.Z. 1971 - Mrs. A. B. Durrant, Rotorua).

name: Puck
description: Deep Red. Small, single. Vigorous, bushy, spreading growth. M. (Aus. 1965 - G. Waterhouse).

name: Pukekura
description: White. Large, semidouble to peony form with large, rounded, outer petals and central stamens tipped with Golden anthers surrounded by folded petals. (N.Z. 1952 - Pukekura Park, New Plymouth).

name: Pumphrey’s Pride
description: Medium Pink shading to Lighter Pink at center with Yellow anthers. Medium, rose form double. Average, spreading, dense growth. M. Cold hardy. (Japonica ‘Tricolor Red’ x Oleifera ‘Plain Jane’). (U.S. 2007 - Ackerman).

name: Punkin
description: Rose Pink outer petals shading to Lighter Pink at center. Small, formal double with incurved petals. Vigorous growth. M. (U.S. 1966 - Novick).

name: Puritan Lass
description: White. Small, formal double. Vigorous, bushy growth. M. (U.S. 1953 - Short).

name: Purity
description: ('Neige d'Oree'; 'Shiragiku'; 'Harriet I. Laub'; 'Refinement'). White. Medium, rose form double to formal double. Vigorous, upright growth. L. Cold hardy. (Japan to U.S. 1887 - Domoto).

name: Purple Dawn
description: See 'Mathotiana'.

name: Purple Emperor
description: See 'Mathotiana'.

name: Purple Fire
description: Bright, Deep Rose Purple. Medium, single form. Average to slow growth. E-L. (Pitardii seedling). (N.Z. 2004 - Haydon).

name: Purple Girl
description: Pink with Purple cast. Medium, semidouble with loose petals. M. (U.S. 1960 - Malbis).

name: Purple Gown
description: ('Zipao' - Chinese Name). Dark Purple Red with pin stripes of White to Wine Red. Large to very large, formal double to peony form with wavy petals. Compact growth. M. (Yunnan Reticulata). (China to U.S. 1948 - Descanso and Peer).

name: Purple Haze
description: Purple (in acid soil). Small, rose form double. Slow, bushy, conical growth. E-M. (Sasanqua 'Reverend Ida' seedling). (U.S. 2012 - Bobby Green, Green Nurseries, Fairhope, AL).

name: Purple Passion
description: Reddish Purple center to Deep Purple outer petals with Dark Purple radial veining; Purple coloration holds true through most of the bloom season but extremely late blooms lose some of the Blue pigment. Medium, formal double. Average, upright, dense growth. M-L. (U.S. 2013 - Richard Dodd, Marshallville, GA).

name: Purple Petal
description: ('Zi Pian' - Chinese Name). Purple/Pink with Yellow stamens. Medium, semidouble with raised fluted petals. Leggy, upright growth. (Reticulata hybrid 'W. P. Gilley' × Lapidea). (U.S. 2012 - John Wang, Orinda, CA).

name: Purple Pine Cone
description: Purple Rose. Medium, semidouble of pine cone form. (U.S. 1950 - Pfingstl).

name: Purple Prince
description: See 'Mathotiana'.

name: Purple Swirl
description: Ashes of Roses turning to Rosy Purple. Small to medium, formal double with five complete swirls of petals radiating from center. Vigorous, upright growth. M-L. (U.S. 1960 - Tammia).

name: Purplette
description: Deep Purplish Red with veining. Miniature, midouble. Average, spreading growth. M-L. (Japonica × Reticulata). (U.S 1983 - Feathers).

name: Putuo Purple Light
description: ('Putuo Ziguang' and 'Pu Tuo Zi Guan' - Chinese Names). Light Purple, paler when fully open, slightly Yellowish White in the middle with a White radial stripe in the center of each petal. Medium, semidouble. Vigorous, upright growth. (Reticulata hybrid 'Suzanne Withers' x Nitidissima hybrid 'Honeymoon'). (U.S. 2005 - John Wang, Orinda, CA).

name: Putuo Ziguang
description: See Putuo Purple Light'.

name: Pygmy
description: Pink to White margined Deep Pink with back of petals Red with Purplish tint. Small, single. Dwarf growth.
